text: I remember hearing this theme way too much in the game due to a lot of backtracking through the plains, but after many years now it feels fresh and I can appreciate it again! I wonder if the 3DS remaster sold well enough for them to consider a sequel at some point, but I'm not too optimistic. Stocke was a highlight character and I wouldn't mind new adventures surrounding him.
author: SupraDarky

text: I don't think so, they really should've held the remaster off and released it on the Switch later down the line
author: Gaming will NEVER be good again

text: I played this game probably 2-3 times on my brothers 3DS. One of the few times I've actually paused in a game to let the music play over and over. One of the few times I cried at a game.  I bought the remaster a few years later when I moved out to make it my own, and it completely lived up to my memory.
author: TPotShax

text: I bought the game along shin megami tensei : strange journey redux, and while smt sj was a blast, I never finished radiant historia. In the remaster the sprites are now simple anime artworks, and the gameplay is quite boring

text: Chrono Trigger formula + kickass Yoko Shimomura soundtrack + great story + innovative turn-based battle system = Radiant Historia. Best Handheld RPG, best ATLUS game.
